title: Sweet Spicy Saint Louis Spare Ribs
description: Saint Louis cut spare ribs slow smoked with Pecan and Apple Wood.
directions: Remove ribs from package and pat dry
Remove the membrane from the back of the ribs
Apply sweet spicy dry rub generously to all sides and put back in fridge for 1-4 hours
Preheat smoker to 225
Smoke ribs for 3 hours and remove ribs when the meat is starting to pull back from the bone
Add brown sugar and honey to one side of the ribs and wrap in aluminum foil
Place back on smoker for about 2 hours
Remove from foil and sauce with favorite bbq sauce
Put back on smoker and allow sauce to thicken on ribs
Probe meat after 30 min, consistency should feel like going through butter
Pull from smoker and let them rest for at least 15 min
Cut and Enjoy

title: Honey BBQ Hickory smoked pulled pork
description: Pork Shoulder with honey/brown sugar/sauce glaze smoked with hickory
directions: Remove shoulder from package and pat dry
Apply yellow mustard liberally to pork.  This will act as a binder for the dry rub
Apply sweet spicy dry rub generously to all sides
Preheat smoker to 225
Smoke shoulder until it reaches an internal temp of 165
Remove from smoker and wrap in aluminum foil
Place back on smoker and increase temperature to 275.
Start probing for tenderness when shoulder reaches an internal temp of 195
When meat probing feels like butter, remove from smoker and let it rest for at least an hour
Enjoy!
